title: WTF IS THIS LAG RIOT!?
body:
Almost every game now I have a problem that makes me lag of the face of the earth and just ****'s up the whole game. I suddenly spike and lag (at random points of the game, usually only once each per game) up to 13000 ping and from the point of which it starts lagging, I can move or use anything, if im auto atking a minion it continues to auto atk like I am not controlling my champion. The game disconnects frequently when the spikes occur even though the characters still move for a little while after the disconnect (like 30 seconds people are still battling but the spells animations dont cast) Every game some guy takes advantage of me and that's how I lost my most recent game and all of my recent losses. How do I win a game if im 0/3 with 10 cs and I disconnect and walk back to base whenever there are minions at my tower. This is stupid cause after I finish lagging it goes back to my original and usual ping WHICH IS 26. Last time I posted of a champion select lag/bug and one the help and support people told me to turn off my firewall of which I did. Really frustrated and waiting for a reply, not playing until I do

edit: And this is ranked btw riot, I already went from one win in my promotion to 3lp because of the lag tilted me off the face of the earth, went on a winning streak and got promoted later but even in 70 percent of my winning games I was disconnecting and lagging for long periods of time although I get lucky as it was in the jg

replies.body:
Hey there,

This sounds like packet loss to me, could you do the following.

* [Download WinMTR](https://sourceforge.net/projects/winmtr/files/WinMTR-v092.zip/download) and run a traceroute to the following IP. (Allow this to run for 5-15 minutes)
  * 103.240.227.5
* Once adequate time has passed, stop the traceroute, export your results as text.
* Run the [ICSI netalyzr](http://netalyzr.icsi.berkeley.edu/).
* Post back with a link to your WinMTR results (You can use [pastebin](http://pastebin.com/) for this) and a link to your ICSI netalyzr results.
Thanks. I turned off my modem for 5 hours and the disconnects haven't occurred in 2 games now but ill do this if it happens again. btw is the wrenchmen like rioters or on the same level or something?

Good to hear you've not experienced the issue since.

The wrenchmen are a part of Riot's Boards Volunteer program, check out [this thread](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/nE4lj5EB-introducing-the-wrenchmen) for more info.

Ok, the spiking has gotten more consistent, went to 7000 ping at lvl 2 so the enemy mid laner just auto atked and ignited me and I died. When I started spiking this game, it immediately stopped all movement, abilities and resistance and the attempting to reconnect thingy was shown for a few seconds. Then after I died, respawned and continued to rek their mid laner, I started spiking in the mid game (started around 18 minutes or so. The spiking usually ranged from 200-700 with it occasionally going up to 1400 and going down to 110 for a brief moment. This continued on (wrote desperately in chat before when it spiked to not fight) until my team set up a good teamfight and I cleaned up the enemies. The spiking has gotten consistent whereas before it only spiked to 10000-14000 once and disconnected before leaving me in peace the whole game (sometimes at bad moments destroying my game).

Just to clarify, I have no other programs running whenever I play league and always turn the wifi off my other devices whenever I start the game

>and always turn the wifi off my other devices whenever I start the game

Does that mean you're playing from a wireless connection yourself?

Could you try switching to a wired connection for me and letting me know if that helps at all.

From your MTR results I also see you're experiencing some packet loss on the way to the Riot servers, this appears to be originating from your ISP as such you'll need to contact them.
